humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, there is metastatic ductal carcinoma identified in the right axillary sentinel lymph node. The report mentions that 'Metastatic ductal carcinoma is identified in blocks 1 and 2 and extranodal tumor is identified in block 1. The size of the tumor is 7 mm.' This indicates that the patient has metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes, which corresponds to N1 according to the AJCC staging system (New Rule 12).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient was found to have metastatic ductal carcinoma in the right axillary sentinel lymph node, with a tumor size of 7 mm and extranodal extension. This information supports the classification of N1, which indicates cancer has spread to 1-3 axillary lymph nodes.
